author: Legal Correspondent
text:
The Haryana government on Thursday told the Supreme Court that it was supplying 1,200 cusecs of water to Delhi, and the Army had secured all three points from where water was supplied.

A Bench comprising Chief Justice of India T.S. Thakur and Justice U.U. Lalit disposed of a PIL petition, filed by Delhi Jal Board, for a direction to ensure supply of water tdisrupted by the violent Jat quota agitation in Haryana.

“We hope and trust that the governments of Haryana and NCT of Delhi will make a joint effort to ensure supply of water to Delhi to avoid any inconvenience to people. We are happy to note that there is no adversarial element in this litigation, as both the governments appear to be willing to cooperate with each other in every respect,” it said.
title: ‘Work together to resolve water crisis’
